title: Job 15:1
text: THEN answered Eliphaz the Temanite, and said,

title: Job 15:2
text: Should a wise man utter vain knowledge, and fill his belly with the east wind?

title: Job 15:3
text: Should he reason with unprofitable talk?  or with speeches wherewith he can do no good?

title: Job 15:4
text: Yea, thou castest off fear, and restrainest prayer before God.

title: Job 15:5
text: For thy mouth uttereth thine iniquity, and thou choosest the tongue of the crafty.

title: Job 15:6
text: Thine own mouth condemneth thee, and not I: yea, thine own lips testify against thee.

title: Job 15:7
text: Art thou the first man that was born?  or wast thou made before the hills?

title: Job 15:8
text: Hast thou heard the secret of God?  and dost thou restrain wisdom to thyself?

title: Job 15:9
text: What knowest thou, that we know not?  what understandest thou, which is not in us?

title: Job 15:10
text: With us are both the grayheaded and very aged men, much elder than thy father.

title: Job 15:11
text: Are the consolations of God small with thee?  is there any secret thing with thee?

title: Job 15:12
text: Why doth thine heart carry thee away?  and what do thy eyes wink at,

title: Job 15:13
text: That thou turnest thy spirit against God, and lettest such words go out of thy mouth?

title: Job 15:14
text: What is man, that he should be clean?  and he which is born of a woman, that he should be righteous?

title: Job 15:15
text: Behold, he putteth no trust in his saints; yea, the heavens are not clean in his sight.

title: Job 15:16
text: How much more abominable and filthy is man, which drinketh iniquity like water?

title: Job 15:17
text: I will shew thee, hear me; and that which I have seen I will declare;

title: Job 15:18
text: Which wise men have told from their fathers, and have not hid it:

title: Job 15:19
text: Unto whom alone the earth was given, and no stranger passed among them.

title: Job 15:20
text: The wicked man travaileth with pain all his days, and the number of years is hidden to the oppressor.

title: Job 15:21
text: A dreadful sound is in his ears: in prosperity the destroyer shall come upon him.

title: Job 15:22
text: He believeth not that he shall return out of darkness, and he is waited for of the sword.

title: Job 15:23
text: He wandereth abroad for bread, saying, Where is it?  he knoweth that the day of darkness is ready at his hand.

title: Job 15:24
text: Trouble and anguish shall make him afraid; they shall prevail against him, as a king ready to the battle.

title: Job 15:25
text: For he stretcheth out his hand against God, and strengtheneth himself against the Almighty.

title: Job 15:26
text: He runneth upon him, even on his neck, upon the thick bosses of his bucklers:

title: Job 15:27
text: Because he covereth his face with his fatness, and maketh collops of fat on his flanks.

title: Job 15:28
text: And he dwelleth in desolate cities, and in houses which no man inhabiteth, which are ready to become heaps.

title: Job 15:29
text: He shall not be rich, neither shall his substance continue, neither shall he prolong the perfection thereof upon the earth.

title: Job 15:30
text: He shall not depart out of darkness; the flame shall dry up his branches, and by the breath of his mouth shall he go away.

title: Job 15:31
text: Let not him that is deceived trust in vanity: for vanity shall be his recompence.

title: Job 15:32
text: It shall be accomplished before his time, and his branch shall not be green.

title: Job 15:33
text: He shall shake off his unripe grape as the vine, and shall cast off his flower as the olive.

title: Job 15:34
text: For the congregation of hypocrites shall be desolate, and fire shall consume the tabernacles of bribery.

title: Job 15:35
text: They conceive mischief, and bring forth vanity, and their belly prepareth deceit.
